name: chub2i

stmt.origin: sseqtri(c0, co(c1, chj, c0), co(c0, chj, c1))

body.origin:
|- wss(c0, co(c1, chj, c0))
-| wss(c0, co(c0, chj, c1))
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c1, chj, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(c0, co(c1, chj, c0))
-| wss(c0, co(c0, chj, c1))
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c1, chj, c0))

body.origin:
|- wss(c0, co(c0, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wcel(c1, cch)

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(c0, co(c1, chj, c0))
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c1, chj, c0))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wcel(c1, cch)

body.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c1, chj, c0))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wcel(c1, cch)

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(c0, co(c1, chj, c0))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wcel(c1, cch)

comment: ` CH ` join is an upper bound of two elements. (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2000.) (New usage is discouraged.)
